hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "The believer is not afflicted by the prick of a thorn or what is worse (or greater) than that, except that by it Allah raises him in rank and removes sin from him."
question: In what ways can suffering and challenges lead to the removal of sins for a believer?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Nothing afflicts the believer, whether fatigue, grief, disease - even a worry that concerns him - except that by it, Allah removes something from his bad deeds."
question: In what ways can personal hardships lead to the removal of bad deeds for a believer?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "Indeed the Muslim remains in the Khurfah (harvest) of Paradise while he visits his brother Muslim."
question: What are the spiritual benefits of maintaining brotherhood among Muslims?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said similarly, but he added in it: "They said: 'What is the Khurfah of Paradise?' And he said: "Its harvest."
question: What significance does the metaphor of 'harvest' hold in the context of Paradise?

hadith-eng: His father said: "Ali took me by the hand and said: 'Come with us to pay a visit to Al-Hasan.' So we found that Abu Musa was with him.' Ali - peace be upon him - said: 'O Abu Musa! Did you come to visit (the sick) or merely (stop by to) visit?' He said: 'No, to visit (the sick).' So Ali said: 'I heard the Messenger of Allah saying: "No Muslim visits (the sick) Muslims in the morning, except that sevety-thousand angels, sent Salat upon him until the evening, and he does not visit at night except that seventy thousand angels sent Salat upon him until the morning, and there will be a garden for him in Paradise."
question: What are the spiritual rewards for visiting a sick Muslim during the day or night?

hadith-eng: "I entered upon Khabab and he had been cauterized on his stomach. He said: 'I do not know any of the Companions of the Prophet who met with the trial I have met with. Indeed I could not find a Dirham during the time of the Prophet, and (now) outside my house there are forty thousand. If it were not that the Messenger of Allah forbade us' - or: 'forbade' - 'from wishing for death, then I would wish for it.'"
question: What is the Islamic perspective on wishing for death during times of hardship?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said that (a Hadith similar to no. 970).
question: What is the role of Jami` at-Tirmidhi in the compilation of hadith literature?

hadith-eng: Jibril came to the Prophet and said: "O Muhammad! Are you suffering?" He said: "Yes." He said: "In the Name of Allah, I recite a prayer (Ruqyah) over you, from the evil of every person and evil eye. In the Name of Allah I recite a prayer (Ruqyah) over you, may Allah cure you."
question: What is the importance of invoking Allah's name in seeking protection and healing?

hadith-eng: "Thabit Al-Bunani and I entered upon Anas bin Malik, and Thabit said: 'O Abu Hamzah! I am suffering from an illness. So Anas said: 'Shall I not recite the Ruqyah of the Messenger of Allah over you?' He said: 'Why, yes.' He said: 'O Allah! Lord of mankind, removed the harm, and cure (him). Indeed You are the One Who cures, there is none who cures except you, a cure that leaves no disease.'"
question: What role does Anas bin Malik play in the transmission of prophetic practices related to healing?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "A Muslim man has no right to spend two nights while he has something to will, except while his will is recorded with him."
question: How does Islam view the responsibility of managing one's affairs before death?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah came to visit me while I was sick. He said: 'Do you have a will?' I said: 'Yes.' He said: 'For how much?' I said: 'All of my wealth, for the cause of Allah.' He said: 'What did you leave for your children?'" He (Sa'd) said: "They are rich in goodness.' He said: 'Will a tenth.'" He (Sa'd) said: "He (pbuh) continued decreasing it until he said: 'Will a third, and a third is too great.'" (One of the narrators:) Abdur-Rahman said: "We considered it recommended that it be less than a third, since the Messenger of Allah said: 'And a third is too great.'"
question: What is the recommended portion of wealth to be allocated in a will for charitable causes according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "Instruct your dying to say: (La illaha illallah) 'None has the right to be worshipped but Allah'
question: How does the declaration of faith impact a person's state at the time of death?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah said to us: 'When you attend to the sick or dying then say only good, for indeed the angels say "Amin" to what you say.'" She said: "When Abu Salamah died I went to the Prophet and said: 'O Messenger of Allah! Abu Salamah has died.' He said: 'Then say: "O Allah forgive me and him, and give me a good replacement for him." She said: "I said tat, and Allah gave a replace that was better than him: The Messenger of Allah."
question: What supplication did the Prophet Muhammad recommend when someone passes away?

hadith-eng: "I saw the Messenger of Allah while he was dying. He had a cup with water in it, he put his hand in the cup then wiped his face with the water, then said: 'O Allah! Help me with the throes of death and the agony of death.'"
question: What does this narration indicate about the Prophet Muhammad's (ﷺ) experience with the agony of death?

hadith-eng: "I was not envious of anyone whose death was easy after I saw the severity the death of the Messenger of Allah."
question: What insights does this narration provide about the Prophet's final moments?

hadith-eng: "I heard Abdullah saying: 'I heard the Messenger of Allah saying: "The believer's soul seeps out, and I do not like the death like that of a donkey." They said: "And what is the death of a donkey?" He said: "A sudden death."]
question: How does the concept of sudden death relate to the understanding of a believer's passing?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "There is nothing that the two Guardian Angels  raise to Allah that they have preserved in a day or night, and Allah finds good in the beginning of the scroll and in the end of the scroll, except that Allah Most High says: 'Bear witness that I have forgiven my servant for what is included in the scroll.'"
question: What does it mean for Allah to find good in the beginning and end of a person's scroll?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said:  "The believer dies with sweat on his brow."
question: What does the presence of sweat on a believer's brow at the time of death symbolize?

hadith-eng: The Prophet entered upon a young man while he was dying. So he said: "How do you feel?" He said: "By Allah! O Messenger of Allah! Indeed I hope in Allah and I fear from my sins." So the Messenger of Allah said: "These two will not be gathered in a worshipper's heart at a time such as this, except that Allah will grant him what he hopes and make him safe from what he fears."
question: What is the significance of balancing hope and fear in a believer's heart?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "Beware of An-Na'i, for indeed announcing one's death is from the deeds of Jahliyyah."
question: What are the implications of following practices from the period of Jahiliyyah in Islam?

hadith-eng: (from the Prophet) similar (to no. 984), but he did not narrate it in Marfu form, and he did not mention in it: "An-Na'i is announcing of one's death."
question: What are the implications of having multiple chains of narration for a single hadith?

hadith-eng: Hudaifah (bin Al-Yaman) said: "When I do not announce about me to anyone, indeed I fear that it would be An-Na'i, and I heard the Messenger of Allah prohibiting from An-Na'i."
question: How does the fear of An-Na'i influence a person's behavior according to Islamic principles?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "(Real) Patience is at the first stroke of the calamity."
question: Why is the initial reaction to a calamity considered crucial in demonstrating patience?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Alllah said: "(Real) Patience is at the first stroke of the calamity."
question: Why is the first response to a calamity considered crucial in demonstrating patience?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet kissed Uthman bin Maz'un when he died, and he was crying." Or, he (one of the narrators) said: "His eyes were brimming with tears."
question: What can be learned about the relationship between the Prophet and his companions from his actions at the time of their death?

hadith-eng: "One of the daughters of the Prophet died, so he said: 'Wash her an odd number of times, three, or five, or more than that as you see fit. Wash her with water and Sidr, and in the last (washing) add camphor, or something from camphor. When you are finished then inform me.' When we finished we informed him so he gave us his waist-sheet and said 'Wrap her in it.'"
question: Why is camphor used in the final washing of a deceased person in Islamic practices?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "The best scent is the perfume of musk."
question: What significance does fragrance hold in Islamic culture?

hadith-eng: The Prophet was asked about musk and he said: "It is the best of your perfumes."
question: What are the characteristics of musk that make it highly valued in Islamic society?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "Ghusl for one who washed him and Wudu for one who carried himm."
question: How does Islamic jurisprudence address the purification rituals related to handling the deceased?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Wear the white among your garments, for indeed they are among the best of your garments, and shroud your dead in them."
question: What is the recommended attire for shrouding the deceased in Islam?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "When one of you shrouds his brother, then let him use the best of his shrouds."
question: What are the guidelines for shrouding a deceased person in Islam?

hadith-eng: Aishah said: "The Prophet was shrouded in three white Yemeni cloths, there was no shirt nor turban among them." He said: "So they mentioned the saying of the others to Aishah, that there were two garments and a Habir Burd. She said: 'A Burd was brought, but they refused it and they did not shroud him in it.'"
question: How did Aishah respond to the claims about the Prophet's shrouding garments?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah shrouded Hamzah bin Abdul-Muttalib in one cloth of Namirah."
question: What is a Namirah cloth and what role does it play in Islamic burial customs?

hadith-eng: "When the news of the death of Ja'far came, the Prophet said: 'Prepare some food for the family of Ja'far, for indeed something has happened to them that will keep them busy.'"
question: What actions are recommended in Islam when a family experiences a loss?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "He who slaps (his) cheeks, tears (his) clothes and calls with the call of the Jahliyyah is not one of us."
question: What is the significance of avoiding pre-Islamic practices in expressing sorrow?

hadith-eng: "A man died among the Ansar named Qarazah bin Ka'b, and he was being wailed over. So Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah came and ascended the Minbar. He uttered thanks and praise to Allah and said: "As for the gravity of wailing in Islam, indeed I heard the Messenger of Allah saying: 'The one who is wailed over is punished as long as he is being wailed over.'"
question: What did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) say about the consequences of wailing for the deceased?

hadith-eng: "There are four matters in my nation that are from the matters of Jahiliyyah which the people will not leave: Wailing, slandering one's lineage, Al-Adwa - a camel gets mange, so one hundred camels get mange - but who gave the first camel mange? And Al-Anwa (saying): "We got rain because of this or that celestial positioning.'"
question: What is the Islamic perspective on attributing natural phenomena to celestial positions?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "The deceased is punished for the crying of his family over him."
question: What are the consequences of excessive lamentation for the deceased in Islam?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "No one dies and they stand over him crying and saying: 'O what a great man he was! O how respectful he was!' except that two angels are appointed for him to poke him (saying): 'Is that you?'"
question: What is the role of angels in questioning the deceased?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "The deceased is punished for the crying of his family over him." So, Aishah said: "May Allah have mercy upon him. He has not lied, but he is mistaken. It is only that the Messenger of Allah said about a Jewish man who died: 'The deceased is being punished and his family is crying over him.'"
question: What role does Aishah play in clarifying misunderstandings related to the sayings of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet took Abdur-Rahman bin Awf by the hand and went with him to his son Ibrahim. He found him in his last breaths, so he took him and put him on his lap and cried. Abdur-Rahman said to him: 'You cry? Didn't you prohibit (your followers) from crying?' He said: 'No. But I prohibited two foolish immoral voices: A voice during a calamity while clawing at one's face and tearing one's clothes, and Shaitan's scream.'" And there is more that is stated in the Hadith.
question: What is the Islamic perspective on expressing grief and sorrow during a calamity?

hadith-eng: Amrah informed him that she heard Aishah, while it was being mentioned to her that Ibn Umar had said that the deceased would be punished for the crying of the living (over him). So Aishah said: 'May Allah forgive Abu Abdur-Rahman. He has not lied, but he is mistaken in the understanding. Rather, the Messenger of Allah passed by a Jewish woman who was being cried over, so he said: 'They are crying over her and she is being punished in her grave.'"
question: What is the Islamic perspective on the consequences faced by the deceased due to the actions of the living?

hadith-eng: His father said: "I saw the Prophet, Abu Bakr, and Umar walking in front of the funeral."
question: What can be learned from the actions of the Prophet, Abu Bakr, and Umar during a funeral?

hadith-eng: "I saw the Prophet, Abu Bakr, and Umar walking in front of the funeral."
question: What can be learned from the actions of the Prophet, Abu Bakr, and Umar regarding funerals?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet, Abu Bakr, and Umar would walk in front of the funeral." Az-Zuhri said: "Salim informed me that his father would walk in front of the funeral."
question: What can be learned from the actions of Abu Bakr and Umar regarding funeral rites?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah would walk in front of the funeral, as did Abu Bakr, Umar and Uthman."
question: What practices did the Prophet Muhammad and his companions follow during funerals?

hadith-eng: From Abdullah bin Mas'ud who said: "We asked the Messenger of Allah about walking behind the funeral. He said: 'Less than a trot. For if he was good, then you will be hastening him to it (goodness), and if he was evil, then it id only an inhabitant of the Fire that is being taken away."  The funeral is (to be) followed. The one who precedes it shall not have the reward of those who follow it.'"
question: How does the behavior of the deceased influence the urgency of the funeral procession?

hadith-eng: "We went with the Prophet (following) a funeral. He saw people riding so he said: 'Are you not ashamed? Indeed Allah's angels are on their feet, while you are on the backs of your beasts'"
question: What role do angels play during a funeral according to Islamic beliefs?

hadith-eng: "We were with the Prophet (following) the funeral of Ibn Ad-Dahbah, and he was on a horse that was walking quickly, and we were around him, and he was trotting."
question: What does the Prophet's choice of a horse and its pace during the funeral procession signify?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet followed the funeral of Ibn Ad-Dahdah walking and he returned on horseback."
question: How did the Prophet demonstrate his participation in funeral rites?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "Hurry up with the funeral (procession) for if it was good, you are advancing it to good, and if it was evil, then you are taking it off your necks."
question: What is the implication of removing an evil person from the community through the funeral process?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah came to Hamza on the Day of Uhud, he stood over him and saw that he had been mutilated. He said: Had it not been that Safiyyah would be distressed, then I would have left him to be eaten by the beasts until he was gathered on the Day of Judgment from their stomachs." He said: "Then he called for a Namirah to shroud him with. When it was extended over his head, it left his feet exposed, and when it was extended over his feet, it left his head exposed." He said: "There were many dead and few cloths." He said: "One, two and three men were shrouded in one cloth and buried in one grave." He said: "So the Messenger of Allah was asking which of them knew the most Quran, so he could put him toward the Qibalh." He said: "So the Messenger of Allah buried them and he did not perform (funeral prayers) for them."
question: What was the significance of determining who knew the most Quran in the burial process?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah would visit the sick, attend the funerals, ride a donkey, accept the invitation of a slave, and on the Day of Banu Quraizah he was on a donkey muzzled with a cord of fibers and a pack-saddle made of fibers."
question: What does the acceptance of invitations from slaves by the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) signify about social equality in Islam?

hadith-eng: "When the Messenger of Allah died, they disagreed over where to bury him. So Abu Bakr said: 'I heard the Messenger of Allah saying something which I have not forgotten, he said: "Allah does not take (the life of ) a Prophet except at the location in which He wants him to be buried.'" So they buried him at the spot of his bed."
question: What does this narration suggest about the divine will in the burial of prophets?

hadith-eng: "When the Messenger of Allah follows a corpse, he would not sit until (the deceased was) placed in the Lahd. A rabbi came upon him and said: 'This is what we do, O Muhammad'" He said: "So the Messenger of Allah sat, and he said: 'Differ from them.'"
question: What actions did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) take when accompanying a funeral procession?

hadith-eng: "I buried my son Sinan and Abu Talhah Al-Khawlani was sitting on the rim of the grave. When I wanted to leave he took me by my hand and said: 'Shall I not inform you of some good new O Abu Sinan!' I said: 'Of course.' He said: 'Ad-Dahhak bin Abdur-Rahman bin Arzab narrated to me, from Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari: "The Messenger of Allah said: 'When a child of the slave (of Allah) died, Allah says to the angels: "Have you taken the fruits of his work." They reply: "Yes." So He says: "What did My slave say?" They reply: "He praised you and mentioned that to You is the return." So Allah says: "Build a house in Paradise for My slave, and name it 'the house of praise.'"
question: What role do angels play in conveying the actions and words of believers to Allah?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet prayed and in the funeral prayer he for An-Najashi, said four Takbir."
question: Who was An-Najashi and why was a funeral prayer performed for him?

hadith-eng: "Zaid bin Arqam would say four Takbir for our funerals. (Once) he said five Takbir for a funeral so we asked him about that and he said: 'The Messenger of Allah would say those Takbir.'"
question: What might be the reasons for variations in the number of Takbirs during funeral prayers?

hadith-eng: from his father who said: "When the Messenger of Allah would perform  the Salat for the funeral he would said: (Allahammaghfir li-hayyina wa mayyittina, wa shahidina wa gha'ibina, wa saghirina wa kabirina, wa dhakarina wa unthana) 'O Allah! Forgive our living and our deceased, our present and our absent, our young and our old, our male and our female.'"
question: Why is it important to include both young and old, male and female, in prayers for forgiveness?

hadith-eng: "I heard the Messenger of Allah, while he was performing Salat for a deceased person. I could hear him saying in his prayer: (Allahummagfir lahu, war hamhu, waghsilhu bil-baradi (waghsilhu) kama yughsaluth-thawb) 'O Allah! Forgive him, have mercy upon him, and wash him with (snow or ice) (and wash him) just as a garment is washed.'"
question: What is the significance of using metaphors like washing with snow or ice in prayers for the deceased?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet recited Fatihatil-Kitab for a funeral (prayer)." (Da'if Jiddan)
question: What are the components of a funeral prayer in Islam?

hadith-eng: "Ibn Abbas performed Salat for a funeral and he recited Fatihatil-Kitab. So I asked him about it and he said: 'It is from the Sunnah' or, 'From the completeness of the Sunnah.'"
question: What does the term 'completeness of the Sunnah' imply in the context of funeral prayers?

hadith-eng: "When Malik bin Hubairah performed Salat for a funeral and the people were few he would divide them into three groups (rows) then say: 'The Messenger of Allah said: "For whomever three rows perform Salat, then it is granted."
question: What actions did Malik bin Hubairah take when there were few people at a funeral prayer?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "No one among the Muslim dies, and Salat is performed for him by a community of Muslims reaching one hundred, and they intercede (supplicate) for him, except that their intercession for him is accepted." In his narration, 'Ali bin Hujr said: "One hundred or more than that."
question: What is the minimum number of Muslims required to perform Salat for their intercession to be accepted for a deceased?

hadith-eng: "There are three times that the Messenger of Allah prohibited us from performing Salat in, burying our dead in: When the sun's rising appears until it has risen up; when the sun is at the zenith until it passes, and when the sun begins its setting, until it has set."
question: What is the significance of the sun's position in determining the permissibility of performing Salat?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "The rider is to be behind the funeral (procession), and the walker where he wishes, and the child should be prayed over."
question: Is it necessary to perform the funeral prayer for a child?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "The child is not prayed over, nor does he inherit, nor is he inherited from until one is sure he was alive at birth."
question: Under what circumstances is a funeral prayer not performed for a child in Islam?

hadith-eng: "I prayed for the funeral of a man with Anas bin Malik, so he stood parallel to his head. Then they came with the body of a woman from the Quraish. They said: 'O Abu Hamzah perform the prayer for her.' So he stood parallel to her waist. Al-Ala bin Ziyad said to him: 'Is this how you saw the Messenger of Allah standing in the place for the funeral as you did for her, and for a place that you stood for the man?' He said: 'Yes.' When he was finished he said: 'Remember (this).'"
question: What differences are observed in the funeral prayer positions for men and women?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet prayed over a woman, so he stood at her middle."
question: What can be learned from the Prophet's actions regarding the conduct of funeral prayers?

hadith-eng: Jabir bin Abdullah informed him that the Prophet had put two men together in one cloth from those who were killed at (the battle of) Uhud, then he said: "Which of them memorized the more of the Qur'an?" When one of them was indicated to him, he put him in the Lahd (first) and said: "I am a witness for those people on the Day of Judgment." And he ordered that they be buried in their blood, and that they not be prayed over, nor washed.
question: What does the practice of burying martyrs in their blood signify in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: Ash-Sha'bi said: "I was informed by one who saw the Prophet: He (pbuh) saw a solitary grave, s he lined his Companions (behind him) to pray over it." It was said to him (Ash-Sha'bi): "Who informed you?" He said: "Ibn Abbas."
question: What role did Ibn Abbas play in conveying this particular event involving the Prophet?

hadith-eng: "Umm Sa'd died while the Prophet was absent. So when he arrived he performed Salat over her, and a month had already passed."
question: What actions did the Prophet take upon returning to find someone had passed away in his absence?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "Indeed your brother An-Najashi has died. So stand to perform Salat for him." He (Imran) said: "We stood and lined up just as the deceased is lined up for, and we prayed for him just as the deceased is prayed for."
question: What is the procedure for lining up during the funeral prayer in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever performs the funeral prayer then he will get a reward equal to a Qirat. Whoever follows it until it is buried then he will get a reward equal to two Qirat, one of them, or the least of them, is similar to Uhud (mountain)." This was mentioned to Ibn Umar, so he sent a message to Aishah to ask her about that, and she said: "Abu Hurairah has told the truth." So Ibn Umar said: "We have missed many Qirat."
question: What additional reward is mentioned for following a funeral procession until burial?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whenever you see a funeral (procession), stand up until it goes ahead of you or it is put down."
question: What are the etiquettes related to funeral processions in Islam?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whenever you see a funeral (procession), stand up (for it). Whoever follows it, then do not sit down until it is put down."
question: Why is it important not to sit down until the funeral is put down?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) stood, then (later) he sat". (Sahih)There are narrations on this topic from Al-Hasan bin 'Ali, and Ibn 'Abbas.Abu Eisa said: The Hadith of 'Ali is a Hasan Sahih Hadith, regarding which there are narrations from four of the Tabi'in narrating it from each other. This is acted upon according to some of the people of knowledge. Ash-Shafi'i said: "This is the most correct thing on this topic" This Hadith abrogates first Hadith: "Whenever you see a funeral (procession), stand up [for it]."Ahmad said: "If he wants, he stands, and if he wants, he does not stand." His proof is that it has been reported that the Prophet (ﷺ) stood, then sat, and this is what Ishaq bin Ibrahim said.(Abu Eisa said:) As for the saying of 'Ali: The Prophet (ﷺ) stood for the funeral and then sat, he means that the Prophet (ﷺ) would stand when he saw a funeral (procession), then he did not do so later, so he would not stand when he saw the funeral (procession).
question: What are the views of different Islamic scholars on standing for a funeral procession?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "The Lahd is for us and the hole is for other than us."
question: What are the different types of graves mentioned in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: "When he Prophet put the deceased in the grave" He said: And Abu Khalid (one of the narrators) said [one time]: "When he placed the deceased in the Lahd" - "He said one time: 'In the Name of Allah, by His command and upon the Millah of the Messenger of Allah.' and one time he said: 'In the Name of Allah, by His command and upon the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah."
question: How does the burial practice reflect adherence to the teachings of the Prophet Muhammad?

hadith-eng: His father said: "The one who made the Lahd in the grave of the Messenger of Allah was Abu Talhah. And the one who placed the velvet cloth under him was Shuqran a freed slave of Messenger of Allah."
question: What is the significance of the velvet cloth placed under the Prophet in his grave?

hadith-eng: "A red velvet cloth was placed in the grave of the Prophet."
question: What are the cultural or historical reasons for placing specific items in graves in Islamic history?

hadith-eng: "Ali said to Abu Al-Hayyaj Al-Asadi: 'I am dispatching you with what the Prophet dispatched me: "That you not leave an elevated grave without leveling it, nor an image without erasing it."
question: Who was tasked with carrying out the Prophet's instructions in this narration?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "Do not sit on the graves nor perform Salat towards them."
question: What are the etiquettes of visiting graves according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: from the Prophet, similar (to no. 1050), but it does not contain "From Abu Idris" and this is what is correct.
question: Why is it important to identify the correct narrators in a hadith?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah prohibited plastering graves, writing on them, building over them, and treading on them."
question: What is the significance of not writing on graves according to Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah passed by the graves of Al-Madinah, so he turned his face towards them and said: (As-Salamu alaikum ya ahlul-qubur! Yaghfirul-lahu lana wa lakun, antum salafuna wa nahnu bil-athar.) 'Peace be upon you O inhabitants of the grave! May Allah forgive us and you; you are our predecessors and we are to follow you.'"
question: What is the importance of seeking forgiveness for both the living and the deceased?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "I had prohibited you from visiting the graves. But Muhammad was permitted to visit the grave of his mother: so visit them, for they will remind you of the Hereafter."
question: Why was there a prohibition on visiting graves initially in Islam?

hadith-eng: "Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Bakr died in Al-Hubshi" He said: "He was carried to Makkah to be buried there. So when Aishah arrived she went to the grave of Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Bakr and she said: "We were like two drinking companions of Jadhimah for such a long time that they would say: 'They will never part.' So when we were separated it was as if I and Malik - due to the length of unity - never spent a night together."
question: What cultural or historical significance might be attached to the reference of 'two drinking companions of Jadhimah' in expressing closeness?

hadith-eng: "Indeed the Messenger of Allah cursed the women who visit the graves."
question: How does Islamic tradition view the act of visiting graves?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet entered a grave during the night, so a torch was lit for him. He took it (the deceased) in from the direction of the Qiblah, and he said: 'May Allah have mercy upon you, you were often invoking (Allah) by reciting the Qur'an.' And he said: 'Allahu Akbar four times."
question: What is the importance of reciting the Qur'an in one's life according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: "A funeral (procession) passed by the Messenger of Allah and they were praising him with good statements. So the Messenger of Allah said: 'Granted.' Then he said: 'You are Allah's witnesses on the earth.'"
question: What role do witnesses play on earth in the context of Islamic beliefs about the afterlife?

hadith-eng: "I arrived in Al-Madinah and while I was sitting with Umar bin Al-Khattab they passed by with a funeral, over (a person) whom they were praising with good. Umar said: 'Granted.' I said to Umar: 'What is granted?' He said: 'I said as the Messenger of Allah said: "There is no Muslim about whom three bear witness, except that he is granted Paradise." He said: "And two (as well)." He said: 'We did not ask the Messenger of Allah about one.'"
question: What did Umar bin Al-Khattab learn from the Prophet regarding the testimony of two or three people?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Any Muslim who has lost three of his children will not be touched by the Fire, except for what will fulfill the oath."
question: What does the phrase 'except for what will fulfill the oath' imply in the context of a Muslim's afterlife?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever has three that precede him (in death) while they did not reach the age of puberty, then they will be a well-fortified fortress for him against the Fire."
question: What are the spiritual benefits mentioned for parents who lose children before they reach puberty?

hadith-eng: "I heard my grandfather, the father of my mother, Simak bin Al-Walid Al-Hanadi narrating, that he heard Ibn Abbas narrated, that he heard the Messenger of Allah saying: "Whoever has two predecessors (in death) among my Ummah, then Allah will admit them into Paradise."So Aishah said to him: "What about one from your Ummar who has one precessor?" He (pbuh) said: "And whoever has one predecessor O Muwaffaqqah!" So she said: "What about one who does not have a predecessor from your Ummah?" He said: "I am the predecessor for my Ummah: you will never suffer (in grief) for (the loss of) anyone similar to me."
question: What reassurance does the Prophet Muhammad provide to those who have lost loved ones?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "The martyrs are five: Those who die of the plague, stomach illness, drowning, being crushed, and the martyr in the cause of Allah"
question: How is dying from a plague viewed in terms of martyrdom in Islam?

hadith-eng: "Sulaiman bin Surad said to Khalid bin Urfutah - or, Khalid said to Sulaiman - 'Did you hear the Messenger of Allah saying: "Whoever is killed by his stomach then he will not be punished in the grave"?' One of them said to the other: "Yes."
question: How does the concept of punishment in the grave relate to the cause of death in Islamic belief?

hadith-eng: The Prophet mentioned the plague and said: "It is an abiding punishment or chastisement that was sent upon a group of the children of Isra'il. So when it occurs in a land while you are in it, then do not leave it. And when it occurs in a land while you are not in it, then do not enter it."
question: What historical context is given about the plague affecting the children of Isra'il?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "Whoever loves to meet Allah, then Allah loves to meet him. And whoever dislikes meeting Allah, then Allah dislikes meeting him."
question: What are the implications of disliking the meeting with Allah according to Islamic beliefs?

hadith-eng: Aishah mentioned that the Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever loves to meet Allah, then Allah loves to meet him. And whoever dislikes meeting Allah, then Allah dislikes meeting him." She said: "O Messenger of Allah! All of us dislike death." He said: "It is not like that. But when the believer is given the good news of Allah's mercy, His pleasure, and His Paradise, then he loves to meet Allah and Allah loves to meet him. Whereas when the disbeliever is given the news of Allah's punishment and His wrath, he dislikes meeting Allah, and Allah dislikes meeting him."
question: What is the reaction of a believer when they receive the good news of Allah's mercy and pleasure?

hadith-eng: "A man killed himself, so the Prophet did not perform Salat over him."
question: What are the implications of a religious leader choosing not to perform a funeral prayer for a particular individual?

hadith-eng: The Prophet was brought a (deceased) man to perform Salat over. So the Prophet said: "Pray for your companion; for indeed he had a debt upon him." Abu Qatadah said: "It shall be upon me." So the Messenger of Allah said: "To pay it off?" (He said: "To pay it off.") So he performed the prayer for him.
question: What are the conditions under which a deceased person may not have the funeral prayer performed for them?

hadith-eng: "A deceased man would be brought to the Messenger of Allah while a debt was due upon him. So he would say: 'Has he left anything to pay off his debt?' If he was told that he had left something to pay it then he would pray (the funeral prayer) for him. Otherwise he would tell the Muslims: 'Pray for your companion.' So when Allah granted him the victories, he stood and said: 'I am more worthy in the case of the believers than they themselves are. So whoever among the believers dies and leaves a debt behind, then it is up to me to fulfill it. And whoever leaves wealth behind, then it is for his heirs.'"
question: What responsibility did the Prophet take upon himself regarding the debts of deceased believers?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "When the deceased - or he said when one of you - is buried, two angels, black and blue (eyed_ come to him. One of them is called Al-Munkar, and the other An-Nakir. They say: 'What did you used to say about this man?' So he says what he was saying (before death) 'He is Allah's slave and His Messenger. I testify that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah and that Muhammad is His slave and His Messenger.' So they say: 'We knew that you would say this.' Then his grave is expanded to seventy by seventy cubits, then it is illuminated for him. Then it is said to him: 'Sleep.' So he said: 'Can I return to my family to inform them?' They say: 'Sleep as a newlywed, whom none awakens but the dearest of his family.' Until Allah resurrects him from his resting place.""If he was a hypocrite he would say: 'I heard people saying something, so I said the same; I do not know.' So they said: 'We knew you would say that.' So the earth is told: 'Constrict him.' So it constricts around him, squeezing his ribs together. He continues being punished like that until Allah resurrects him from his resting place."
question: What are the consequences for a hypocrite when questioned in the grave according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "When a person dies, he is shown his place [both in the morning and the evening]. If he is one of the people of Paradise; he is shown his place among the people of Paradise, and if he one of the people of the Fire; he is shown his place among the people of the Fire. Then it is said to him: 'This is your place until Allah resurrects you on the Day of Judgment.'"
question: What is the significance of being shown one's place in the afterlife before the Day of Judgment?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "Whoever consoles a person with an affliction, then he gets the same reward as him."
question: What are the spiritual benefits of supporting someone during their time of affliction?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "No Muslim dies on the day of Friday, nor the night of Friday, except that Allah protects him from the trials of the grave."
question: What are the trials of the grave that a Muslim seeks protection from?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said to him: "O Ali! Three are not to be delayed: Salat when it is due, the funeral when it is presented, and (marriage) for the single woman when someone compatible is found."
question: What is the significance of promptly conducting a funeral in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever consoles a bereaved mother, he will be clothes with a Burd in Paradise."
question: How does Islam view the act of providing comfort to those who have lost a loved one?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah said, 'Allahu Akbar' over the deceased, so he raised his hands with the first Takbir, and he placed his right (hand) over his left."
question: What is the importance of raising hands with the first Takbir in Islamic prayer rituals?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "The believer's soul is suspended by his debt until it is settled for him."
question: What are the spiritual implications of leaving debts unsettled in Islam?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "The believer's soul is suspended by his debt until it is settled for him."
question: What are the implications of leaving debts unsettled for a Muslim after death?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "The believer is not afflicted by the prick of a thorn or what is worse (or greater) than that, except that by it Allah raises him in rank and removes sin from him."
question: How does Allah use trials and tribulations to elevate the rank of a believer?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Nothing afflicts the believer, whether fatigue, grief, disease - even a worry that concerns him - except that by it, Allah removes something from his bad deeds."
question: How does the concept of divine wisdom manifest in the trials faced by believers?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "Indeed the Muslim remains in the Khurfah (harvest) of Paradise while he visits his brother Muslim."
question: How does the act of visiting a Muslim brother reflect on one's faith and character?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said similarly, but he added in it: "They said: 'What is the Khurfah of Paradise?' And he said: "Its harvest."
question: How do metaphors enhance the understanding of spiritual concepts in Islam?

hadith-eng: His father said: "Ali took me by the hand and said: 'Come with us to pay a visit to Al-Hasan.' So we found that Abu Musa was with him.' Ali - peace be upon him - said: 'O Abu Musa! Did you come to visit (the sick) or merely (stop by to) visit?' He said: 'No, to visit (the sick).' So Ali said: 'I heard the Messenger of Allah saying: "No Muslim visits (the sick) Muslims in the morning, except that sevety-thousand angels, sent Salat upon him until the evening, and he does not visit at night except that seventy thousand angels sent Salat upon him until the morning, and there will be a garden for him in Paradise."
question: How does visiting the sick relate to the concept of earning a place in Paradise?

hadith-eng: "I entered upon Khabab and he had been cauterized on his stomach. He said: 'I do not know any of the Companions of the Prophet who met with the trial I have met with. Indeed I could not find a Dirham during the time of the Prophet, and (now) outside my house there are forty thousand. If it were not that the Messenger of Allah forbade us' - or: 'forbade' - 'from wishing for death, then I would wish for it.'"
question: What does cauterization signify in the context of the trials faced by early Muslims?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said that (a Hadith similar to no. 970).
question: How do scholars verify the authenticity of a hadith when it is mentioned in multiple narrations?

hadith-eng: Jibril came to the Prophet and said: "O Muhammad! Are you suffering?" He said: "Yes." He said: "In the Name of Allah, I recite a prayer (Ruqyah) over you, from the evil of every person and evil eye. In the Name of Allah I recite a prayer (Ruqyah) over you, may Allah cure you."
question: How does the interaction between Jibril and the Prophet highlight the importance of spiritual care in Islam?

hadith-eng: "Thabit Al-Bunani and I entered upon Anas bin Malik, and Thabit said: 'O Abu Hamzah! I am suffering from an illness. So Anas said: 'Shall I not recite the Ruqyah of the Messenger of Allah over you?' He said: 'Why, yes.' He said: 'O Allah! Lord of mankind, removed the harm, and cure (him). Indeed You are the One Who cures, there is none who cures except you, a cure that leaves no disease.'"
question: What is the importance of seeking a cure that leaves no disease in Islamic supplications?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "A Muslim man has no right to spend two nights while he has something to will, except while his will is recorded with him."
question: What are the potential consequences of not having a will documented in Islam?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah came to visit me while I was sick. He said: 'Do you have a will?' I said: 'Yes.' He said: 'For how much?' I said: 'All of my wealth, for the cause of Allah.' He said: 'What did you leave for your children?'" He (Sa'd) said: "They are rich in goodness.' He said: 'Will a tenth.'" He (Sa'd) said: "He (pbuh) continued decreasing it until he said: 'Will a third, and a third is too great.'" (One of the narrators:) Abdur-Rahman said: "We considered it recommended that it be less than a third, since the Messenger of Allah said: 'And a third is too great.'"
question: Why is it important to consider the financial well-being of one's heirs when drafting a will in Islam?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "Instruct your dying to say: (La illaha illallah) 'None has the right to be worshipped but Allah'
question: What are the spiritual benefits of reciting 'La illaha illallah' during one's final moments?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah said to us: 'When you attend to the sick or dying then say only good, for indeed the angels say "Amin" to what you say.'" She said: "When Abu Salamah died I went to the Prophet and said: 'O Messenger of Allah! Abu Salamah has died.' He said: 'Then say: "O Allah forgive me and him, and give me a good replacement for him." She said: "I said tat, and Allah gave a replace that was better than him: The Messenger of Allah."
question: How can one seek a good replacement after the loss of a loved one according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: "I saw the Messenger of Allah while he was dying. He had a cup with water in it, he put his hand in the cup then wiped his face with the water, then said: 'O Allah! Help me with the throes of death and the agony of death.'"
question: What significance does water have in the actions of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) during his last moments?

hadith-eng: "I was not envious of anyone whose death was easy after I saw the severity the death of the Messenger of Allah."
question: How might the severity of a person's death influence the feelings of those around them?

hadith-eng: "I heard Abdullah saying: 'I heard the Messenger of Allah saying: "The believer's soul seeps out, and I do not like the death like that of a donkey." They said: "And what is the death of a donkey?" He said: "A sudden death."]
question: What can be inferred about the nature of death for a believer from this narration?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "There is nothing that the two Guardian Angels  raise to Allah that they have preserved in a day or night, and Allah finds good in the beginning of the scroll and in the end of the scroll, except that Allah Most High says: 'Bear witness that I have forgiven my servant for what is included in the scroll.'"
question: What assurance does Allah give regarding the forgiveness of a servant's deeds?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said:  "The believer dies with sweat on his brow."
question: How does Islamic tradition describe the physical signs of a believer's passing?

hadith-eng: The Prophet entered upon a young man while he was dying. So he said: "How do you feel?" He said: "By Allah! O Messenger of Allah! Indeed I hope in Allah and I fear from my sins." So the Messenger of Allah said: "These two will not be gathered in a worshipper's heart at a time such as this, except that Allah will grant him what he hopes and make him safe from what he fears."
question: How does Allah respond to a believer who hopes in Him and fears his sins at the time of death?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "Beware of An-Na'i, for indeed announcing one's death is from the deeds of Jahliyyah."
question: Why is it important to be cautious about certain cultural practices in light of Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: (from the Prophet) similar (to no. 984), but he did not narrate it in Marfu form, and he did not mention in it: "An-Na'i is announcing of one's death."
question: Why might a narrator choose to omit certain elements when recounting a hadith?

hadith-eng: Hudaifah (bin Al-Yaman) said: "When I do not announce about me to anyone, indeed I fear that it would be An-Na'i, and I heard the Messenger of Allah prohibiting from An-Na'i."
question: What are the potential consequences of engaging in An-Na'i in a Muslim community?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "(Real) Patience is at the first stroke of the calamity."
question: What can be learned about the nature of true patience from one's immediate response to difficulties?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Alllah said: "(Real) Patience is at the first stroke of the calamity."
question: What does it mean to have 'real' patience during difficult times?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet kissed Uthman bin Maz'un when he died, and he was crying." Or, he (one of the narrators) said: "His eyes were brimming with tears."
question: How does the Prophet's behavior at the death of a companion illustrate the human aspect of his personality?

hadith-eng: "One of the daughters of the Prophet died, so he said: 'Wash her an odd number of times, three, or five, or more than that as you see fit. Wash her with water and Sidr, and in the last (washing) add camphor, or something from camphor. When you are finished then inform me.' When we finished we informed him so he gave us his waist-sheet and said 'Wrap her in it.'"
question: What is the importance of informing the family or responsible person after completing the washing of the deceased?

hadith-eng: The Prophet was asked about musk and he said: "It is the best of your perfumes."
question: What guidance did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) provide regarding the use of perfumes?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "Ghusl for one who washed him and Wudu for one who carried himm."
question: What are the different purification practices required when dealing with a deceased body in Islam?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Wear the white among your garments, for indeed they are among the best of your garments, and shroud your dead in them."
question: How does the choice of garment color relate to Islamic practices for the living and the deceased?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "When one of you shrouds his brother, then let him use the best of his shrouds."
question: Why is it important to consider the quality of the shroud in Islamic burial practices?

hadith-eng: Aishah said: "The Prophet was shrouded in three white Yemeni cloths, there was no shirt nor turban among them." He said: "So they mentioned the saying of the others to Aishah, that there were two garments and a Habir Burd. She said: 'A Burd was brought, but they refused it and they did not shroud him in it.'"
question: What does the refusal to use a Burd in the Prophet's shroud indicate about the companions' choices?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah shrouded Hamzah bin Abdul-Muttalib in one cloth of Namirah."
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) conduct funeral rites for his companions?

hadith-eng: "When the news of the death of Ja'far came, the Prophet said: 'Prepare some food for the family of Ja'far, for indeed something has happened to them that will keep them busy.'"
question: How can the community assist a family that is dealing with a significant event or loss?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "He who slaps (his) cheeks, tears (his) clothes and calls with the call of the Jahliyyah is not one of us."
question: What behaviors are discouraged in Islam when dealing with loss or tragedy?

hadith-eng: "A man died among the Ansar named Qarazah bin Ka'b, and he was being wailed over. So Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah came and ascended the Minbar. He uttered thanks and praise to Allah and said: "As for the gravity of wailing in Islam, indeed I heard the Messenger of Allah saying: 'The one who is wailed over is punished as long as he is being wailed over.'"
question: What actions did Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah take to address the issue of wailing in the community?

hadith-eng: "There are four matters in my nation that are from the matters of Jahiliyyah which the people will not leave: Wailing, slandering one's lineage, Al-Adwa - a camel gets mange, so one hundred camels get mange - but who gave the first camel mange? And Al-Anwa (saying): "We got rain because of this or that celestial positioning.'"
question: Why is slandering one's lineage considered a negative practice in Islam?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "The deceased is punished for the crying of his family over him."
question: How should Muslims conduct themselves during the mourning period to avoid causing harm to the deceased?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "No one dies and they stand over him crying and saying: 'O what a great man he was! O how respectful he was!' except that two angels are appointed for him to poke him (saying): 'Is that you?'"
question: How does public perception of a person's character affect their afterlife in Islam?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "The deceased is punished for the crying of his family over him." So, Aishah said: "May Allah have mercy upon him. He has not lied, but he is mistaken. It is only that the Messenger of Allah said about a Jewish man who died: 'The deceased is being punished and his family is crying over him.'"
question: How does the cultural or religious background of individuals mentioned in hadiths affect their interpretation?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet took Abdur-Rahman bin Awf by the hand and went with him to his son Ibrahim. He found him in his last breaths, so he took him and put him on his lap and cried. Abdur-Rahman said to him: 'You cry? Didn't you prohibit (your followers) from crying?' He said: 'No. But I prohibited two foolish immoral voices: A voice during a calamity while clawing at one's face and tearing one's clothes, and Shaitan's scream.'" And there is more that is stated in the Hadith.
question: What actions are discouraged in Islam when facing a calamity or loss?

hadith-eng: Amrah informed him that she heard Aishah, while it was being mentioned to her that Ibn Umar had said that the deceased would be punished for the crying of the living (over him). So Aishah said: 'May Allah forgive Abu Abdur-Rahman. He has not lied, but he is mistaken in the understanding. Rather, the Messenger of Allah passed by a Jewish woman who was being cried over, so he said: 'They are crying over her and she is being punished in her grave.'"
question: How does the example of the Jewish woman illustrate the concept of punishment in the grave?

hadith-eng: His father said: "I saw the Prophet, Abu Bakr, and Umar walking in front of the funeral."
question: What is the role of community leaders in funeral rites according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: "I saw the Prophet, Abu Bakr, and Umar walking in front of the funeral."
question: What is the role of community leaders in funeral rites according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet, Abu Bakr, and Umar would walk in front of the funeral." Az-Zuhri said: "Salim informed me that his father would walk in front of the funeral."
question: What role does following the example of the Prophet and his companions play in Islamic funeral practices?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah would walk in front of the funeral, as did Abu Bakr, Umar and Uthman."
question: What can be learned from the actions of the Prophet and his companions regarding funeral rites?

hadith-eng: From Abdullah bin Mas'ud who said: "We asked the Messenger of Allah about walking behind the funeral. He said: 'Less than a trot. For if he was good, then you will be hastening him to it (goodness), and if he was evil, then it id only an inhabitant of the Fire that is being taken away."  The funeral is (to be) followed. The one who precedes it shall not have the reward of those who follow it.'"
question: What is the consequence of preceding a funeral procession in terms of spiritual reward?

hadith-eng: "We went with the Prophet (following) a funeral. He saw people riding so he said: 'Are you not ashamed? Indeed Allah's angels are on their feet, while you are on the backs of your beasts'"
question: Why might it be considered disrespectful to ride on animals during a funeral procession?

hadith-eng: "We were with the Prophet (following) the funeral of Ibn Ad-Dahbah, and he was on a horse that was walking quickly, and we were around him, and he was trotting."
question: How did the companions of the Prophet behave during the funeral procession according to this account?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet followed the funeral of Ibn Ad-Dahdah walking and he returned on horseback."
question: What can be learned about the Prophet's behavior during funerals from his actions?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "Hurry up with the funeral (procession) for if it was good, you are advancing it to good, and if it was evil, then you are taking it off your necks."
question: How does the concept of good and evil influence the handling of a deceased person's funeral?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah came to Hamza on the Day of Uhud, he stood over him and saw that he had been mutilated. He said: Had it not been that Safiyyah would be distressed, then I would have left him to be eaten by the beasts until he was gathered on the Day of Judgment from their stomachs." He said: "Then he called for a Namirah to shroud him with. When it was extended over his head, it left his feet exposed, and when it was extended over his feet, it left his head exposed." He said: "There were many dead and few cloths." He said: "One, two and three men were shrouded in one cloth and buried in one grave." He said: "So the Messenger of Allah was asking which of them knew the most Quran, so he could put him toward the Qibalh." He said: "So the Messenger of Allah buried them and he did not perform (funeral prayers) for them."
question: What does the hadith imply about the Prophet's concern for the feelings of the bereaved, such as Safiyyah?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah would visit the sick, attend the funerals, ride a donkey, accept the invitation of a slave, and on the Day of Banu Quraizah he was on a donkey muzzled with a cord of fibers and a pack-saddle made of fibers."
question: What can be learned from the Prophet Muhammad's (ﷺ) choice of transportation regarding his lifestyle?

hadith-eng: "When the Messenger of Allah died, they disagreed over where to bury him. So Abu Bakr said: 'I heard the Messenger of Allah saying something which I have not forgotten, he said: "Allah does not take (the life of ) a Prophet except at the location in which He wants him to be buried.'" So they buried him at the spot of his bed."
question: What role did the companions play in the burial of the Prophet Muhammad?

hadith-eng: "When the Messenger of Allah follows a corpse, he would not sit until (the deceased was) placed in the Lahd. A rabbi came upon him and said: 'This is what we do, O Muhammad'" He said: "So the Messenger of Allah sat, and he said: 'Differ from them.'"
question: What is the importance of the Lahd in Islamic burial practices?

hadith-eng: "I buried my son Sinan and Abu Talhah Al-Khawlani was sitting on the rim of the grave. When I wanted to leave he took me by my hand and said: 'Shall I not inform you of some good new O Abu Sinan!' I said: 'Of course.' He said: 'Ad-Dahhak bin Abdur-Rahman bin Arzab narrated to me, from Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari: "The Messenger of Allah said: 'When a child of the slave (of Allah) died, Allah says to the angels: "Have you taken the fruits of his work." They reply: "Yes." So He says: "What did My slave say?" They reply: "He praised you and mentioned that to You is the return." So Allah says: "Build a house in Paradise for My slave, and name it 'the house of praise.'"
question: What is the concept of 'the house of praise' in Paradise and how is it earned?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet prayed and in the funeral prayer he for An-Najashi, said four Takbir."
question: What does this practice indicate about the inclusivity of funeral prayers in Islam?

hadith-eng: "Zaid bin Arqam would say four Takbir for our funerals. (Once) he said five Takbir for a funeral so we asked him about that and he said: 'The Messenger of Allah would say those Takbir.'"
question: How do the actions of the Prophet influence Islamic funeral rites?

hadith-eng: from his father who said: "When the Messenger of Allah would perform  the Salat for the funeral he would said: (Allahammaghfir li-hayyina wa mayyittina, wa shahidina wa gha'ibina, wa saghirina wa kabirina, wa dhakarina wa unthana) 'O Allah! Forgive our living and our deceased, our present and our absent, our young and our old, our male and our female.'"
question: What does this supplication indicate about the inclusivity of Islamic prayers for the community?

hadith-eng: "I heard the Messenger of Allah, while he was performing Salat for a deceased person. I could hear him saying in his prayer: (Allahummagfir lahu, war hamhu, waghsilhu bil-baradi (waghsilhu) kama yughsaluth-thawb) 'O Allah! Forgive him, have mercy upon him, and wash him with (snow or ice) (and wash him) just as a garment is washed.'"
question: What can be learned about the Prophet's compassion and concern for the deceased from his prayers?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet recited Fatihatil-Kitab for a funeral (prayer)." (Da'if Jiddan)
question: What is the role of Surah Al-Fatiha in Islamic prayers?

hadith-eng: "Ibn Abbas performed Salat for a funeral and he recited Fatihatil-Kitab. So I asked him about it and he said: 'It is from the Sunnah' or, 'From the completeness of the Sunnah.'"
question: Why might Ibn Abbas have emphasized the recitation of Surah Al-Fatiha in funeral prayers?

hadith-eng: "When Malik bin Hubairah performed Salat for a funeral and the people were few he would divide them into three groups (rows) then say: 'The Messenger of Allah said: "For whomever three rows perform Salat, then it is granted."
question: What did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) say about the reward for having three rows in a funeral prayer?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "No one among the Muslim dies, and Salat is performed for him by a community of Muslims reaching one hundred, and they intercede (supplicate) for him, except that their intercession for him is accepted." In his narration, 'Ali bin Hujr said: "One hundred or more than that."
question: What role does supplication play in the acceptance of intercession for a deceased Muslim?

hadith-eng: "There are three times that the Messenger of Allah prohibited us from performing Salat in, burying our dead in: When the sun's rising appears until it has risen up; when the sun is at the zenith until it passes, and when the sun begins its setting, until it has set."
question: How does the prohibition of Salat at certain times reflect on the daily routine of a Muslim?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "The rider is to be behind the funeral (procession), and the walker where he wishes, and the child should be prayed over."
question: What are the etiquettes of participating in a funeral procession?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "The child is not prayed over, nor does he inherit, nor is he inherited from until one is sure he was alive at birth."
question: How does Islamic law determine the inheritance rights of a newborn?

hadith-eng: "I prayed for the funeral of a man with Anas bin Malik, so he stood parallel to his head. Then they came with the body of a woman from the Quraish. They said: 'O Abu Hamzah perform the prayer for her.' So he stood parallel to her waist. Al-Ala bin Ziyad said to him: 'Is this how you saw the Messenger of Allah standing in the place for the funeral as you did for her, and for a place that you stood for the man?' He said: 'Yes.' When he was finished he said: 'Remember (this).'"
question: Why is it important to remember the practices of the Prophet in religious rituals?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet prayed over a woman, so he stood at her middle."
question: How does the position of the imam during a funeral prayer vary based on the deceased's gender?

hadith-eng: Jabir bin Abdullah informed him that the Prophet had put two men together in one cloth from those who were killed at (the battle of) Uhud, then he said: "Which of them memorized the more of the Qur'an?" When one of them was indicated to him, he put him in the Lahd (first) and said: "I am a witness for those people on the Day of Judgment." And he ordered that they be buried in their blood, and that they not be prayed over, nor washed.
question: Why were the martyrs of the battle not prayed over or washed before burial according to Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: Ash-Sha'bi said: "I was informed by one who saw the Prophet: He (pbuh) saw a solitary grave, s he lined his Companions (behind him) to pray over it." It was said to him (Ash-Sha'bi): "Who informed you?" He said: "Ibn Abbas."
question: Why might it be important to know who informed Ash-Sha'bi about the event involving the Prophet?

hadith-eng: "Umm Sa'd died while the Prophet was absent. So when he arrived he performed Salat over her, and a month had already passed."
question: What does this narration imply about the timing and permissibility of funeral prayers in Islam?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "Indeed your brother An-Najashi has died. So stand to perform Salat for him." He (Imran) said: "We stood and lined up just as the deceased is lined up for, and we prayed for him just as the deceased is prayed for."
question: What does the practice of praying for a deceased person indicate about the Islamic view on community and brotherhood?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever performs the funeral prayer then he will get a reward equal to a Qirat. Whoever follows it until it is buried then he will get a reward equal to two Qirat, one of them, or the least of them, is similar to Uhud (mountain)." This was mentioned to Ibn Umar, so he sent a message to Aishah to ask her about that, and she said: "Abu Hurairah has told the truth." So Ibn Umar said: "We have missed many Qirat."
question: How does the concept of Qirat relate to the rewards for funeral prayers?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whenever you see a funeral (procession), stand up until it goes ahead of you or it is put down."
question: Why is it important to show respect during a funeral procession?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whenever you see a funeral (procession), stand up (for it). Whoever follows it, then do not sit down until it is put down."
question: How does standing for a funeral procession reflect respect for the deceased?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) stood, then (later) he sat". (Sahih)There are narrations on this topic from Al-Hasan bin 'Ali, and Ibn 'Abbas.Abu Eisa said: The Hadith of 'Ali is a Hasan Sahih Hadith, regarding which there are narrations from four of the Tabi'in narrating it from each other. This is acted upon according to some of the people of knowledge. Ash-Shafi'i said: "This is the most correct thing on this topic" This Hadith abrogates first Hadith: "Whenever you see a funeral (procession), stand up [for it]."Ahmad said: "If he wants, he stands, and if he wants, he does not stand." His proof is that it has been reported that the Prophet (ﷺ) stood, then sat, and this is what Ishaq bin Ibrahim said.(Abu Eisa said:) As for the saying of 'Ali: The Prophet (ﷺ) stood for the funeral and then sat, he means that the Prophet (ﷺ) would stand when he saw a funeral (procession), then he did not do so later, so he would not stand when he saw the funeral (procession).
question: How does abrogation play a role in the practice of standing for a funeral procession?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "The Lahd is for us and the hole is for other than us."
question: Why might the Prophet have specified different burial methods for Muslims and others?

hadith-eng: "When he Prophet put the deceased in the grave" He said: And Abu Khalid (one of the narrators) said [one time]: "When he placed the deceased in the Lahd" - "He said one time: 'In the Name of Allah, by His command and upon the Millah of the Messenger of Allah.' and one time he said: 'In the Name of Allah, by His command and upon the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah."
question: What is the difference between using the terms 'Millah' and 'Sunnah' in the context of burial?

hadith-eng: His father said: "The one who made the Lahd in the grave of the Messenger of Allah was Abu Talhah. And the one who placed the velvet cloth under him was Shuqran a freed slave of Messenger of Allah."
question: Who was Abu Talhah in the context of the Prophet's burial?

hadith-eng: "A red velvet cloth was placed in the grave of the Prophet."
question: How does the burial of the Prophet Muhammad reflect the customs and practices of his time?

hadith-eng: "Ali said to Abu Al-Hayyaj Al-Asadi: 'I am dispatching you with what the Prophet dispatched me: "That you not leave an elevated grave without leveling it, nor an image without erasing it."
question: What is the significance of leveling graves in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "Do not sit on the graves nor perform Salat towards them."
question: How does Islam view the sanctity of graves and burial sites?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah prohibited plastering graves, writing on them, building over them, and treading on them."
question: How does Islam view the practice of treading on graves?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah passed by the graves of Al-Madinah, so he turned his face towards them and said: (As-Salamu alaikum ya ahlul-qubur! Yaghfirul-lahu lana wa lakun, antum salafuna wa nahnu bil-athar.) 'Peace be upon you O inhabitants of the grave! May Allah forgive us and you; you are our predecessors and we are to follow you.'"
question: What does the phrase 'you are our predecessors and we are to follow you' imply about the cycle of life and death in Islam?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "I had prohibited you from visiting the graves. But Muhammad was permitted to visit the grave of his mother: so visit them, for they will remind you of the Hereafter."
question: What change in practice regarding visiting graves is mentioned in the hadith?

hadith-eng: "Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Bakr died in Al-Hubshi" He said: "He was carried to Makkah to be buried there. So when Aishah arrived she went to the grave of Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Bakr and she said: "We were like two drinking companions of Jadhimah for such a long time that they would say: 'They will never part.' So when we were separated it was as if I and Malik - due to the length of unity - never spent a night together."
question: What does the act of carrying Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Bakr to Makkah for burial signify in terms of Islamic burial practices?

hadith-eng: "Indeed the Messenger of Allah cursed the women who visit the graves."
question: What are the cultural and religious reasons behind prohibiting certain actions in Islam?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet entered a grave during the night, so a torch was lit for him. He took it (the deceased) in from the direction of the Qiblah, and he said: 'May Allah have mercy upon you, you were often invoking (Allah) by reciting the Qur'an.' And he said: 'Allahu Akbar four times."
question: What is the meaning and significance of saying 'Allahu Akbar' during a burial?

hadith-eng: "A funeral (procession) passed by the Messenger of Allah and they were praising him with good statements. So the Messenger of Allah said: 'Granted.' Then he said: 'You are Allah's witnesses on the earth.'"
question: How does the concept of being Allah's witnesses on earth influence Muslim behavior and accountability?

hadith-eng: "I arrived in Al-Madinah and while I was sitting with Umar bin Al-Khattab they passed by with a funeral, over (a person) whom they were praising with good. Umar said: 'Granted.' I said to Umar: 'What is granted?' He said: 'I said as the Messenger of Allah said: "There is no Muslim about whom three bear witness, except that he is granted Paradise." He said: "And two (as well)." He said: 'We did not ask the Messenger of Allah about one.'"
question: Why is the number of people bearing witness important in Islamic teachings about the afterlife?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Any Muslim who has lost three of his children will not be touched by the Fire, except for what will fulfill the oath."
question: What are the spiritual implications for a Muslim who has lost three children?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever has three that precede him (in death) while they did not reach the age of puberty, then they will be a well-fortified fortress for him against the Fire."
question: How does the concept of a 'well-fortified fortress' relate to the afterlife in Islamic belief?

hadith-eng: "I heard my grandfather, the father of my mother, Simak bin Al-Walid Al-Hanadi narrating, that he heard Ibn Abbas narrated, that he heard the Messenger of Allah saying: "Whoever has two predecessors (in death) among my Ummah, then Allah will admit them into Paradise."So Aishah said to him: "What about one from your Ummar who has one precessor?" He (pbuh) said: "And whoever has one predecessor O Muwaffaqqah!" So she said: "What about one who does not have a predecessor from your Ummah?" He said: "I am the predecessor for my Ummah: you will never suffer (in grief) for (the loss of) anyone similar to me."
question: How does the Prophet Muhammad serve as a predecessor for his Ummah?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "The martyrs are five: Those who die of the plague, stomach illness, drowning, being crushed, and the martyr in the cause of Allah"
question: What significance does dying from a stomach illness hold in the context of martyrdom?

hadith-eng: "Sulaiman bin Surad said to Khalid bin Urfutah - or, Khalid said to Sulaiman - 'Did you hear the Messenger of Allah saying: "Whoever is killed by his stomach then he will not be punished in the grave"?' One of them said to the other: "Yes."
question: What are the implications of a person's cause of death on their afterlife according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: The Prophet mentioned the plague and said: "It is an abiding punishment or chastisement that was sent upon a group of the children of Isra'il. So when it occurs in a land while you are in it, then do not leave it. And when it occurs in a land while you are not in it, then do not enter it."
question: What are the implications of staying in a land affected by a plague according to the hadith?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "Whoever loves to meet Allah, then Allah loves to meet him. And whoever dislikes meeting Allah, then Allah dislikes meeting him."
question: How does the concept of meeting Allah influence a believer's actions and mindset?

hadith-eng: Aishah mentioned that the Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever loves to meet Allah, then Allah loves to meet him. And whoever dislikes meeting Allah, then Allah dislikes meeting him." She said: "O Messenger of Allah! All of us dislike death." He said: "It is not like that. But when the believer is given the good news of Allah's mercy, His pleasure, and His Paradise, then he loves to meet Allah and Allah loves to meet him. Whereas when the disbeliever is given the news of Allah's punishment and His wrath, he dislikes meeting Allah, and Allah dislikes meeting him."
question: How does the concept of meeting Allah differ for believers and disbelievers?

hadith-eng: "A man killed himself, so the Prophet did not perform Salat over him."
question: How does the community's response to suicide reflect Islamic teachings on life and death?

hadith-eng: The Prophet was brought a (deceased) man to perform Salat over. So the Prophet said: "Pray for your companion; for indeed he had a debt upon him." Abu Qatadah said: "It shall be upon me." So the Messenger of Allah said: "To pay it off?" (He said: "To pay it off.") So he performed the prayer for him.
question: What role does the assurance of debt repayment play in Islamic funeral rites?

hadith-eng: "A deceased man would be brought to the Messenger of Allah while a debt was due upon him. So he would say: 'Has he left anything to pay off his debt?' If he was told that he had left something to pay it then he would pray (the funeral prayer) for him. Otherwise he would tell the Muslims: 'Pray for your companion.' So when Allah granted him the victories, he stood and said: 'I am more worthy in the case of the believers than they themselves are. So whoever among the believers dies and leaves a debt behind, then it is up to me to fulfill it. And whoever leaves wealth behind, then it is for his heirs.'"
question: What happens to the wealth left behind by a deceased believer according to the Prophet's statement?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "When the deceased - or he said when one of you - is buried, two angels, black and blue (eyed_ come to him. One of them is called Al-Munkar, and the other An-Nakir. They say: 'What did you used to say about this man?' So he says what he was saying (before death) 'He is Allah's slave and His Messenger. I testify that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah and that Muhammad is His slave and His Messenger.' So they say: 'We knew that you would say this.' Then his grave is expanded to seventy by seventy cubits, then it is illuminated for him. Then it is said to him: 'Sleep.' So he said: 'Can I return to my family to inform them?' They say: 'Sleep as a newlywed, whom none awakens but the dearest of his family.' Until Allah resurrects him from his resting place.""If he was a hypocrite he would say: 'I heard people saying something, so I said the same; I do not know.' So they said: 'We knew you would say that.' So the earth is told: 'Constrict him.' So it constricts around him, squeezing his ribs together. He continues being punished like that until Allah resurrects him from his resting place."
question: What is the role of one's testimony in determining the condition of their grave?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "When a person dies, he is shown his place [both in the morning and the evening]. If he is one of the people of Paradise; he is shown his place among the people of Paradise, and if he one of the people of the Fire; he is shown his place among the people of the Fire. Then it is said to him: 'This is your place until Allah resurrects you on the Day of Judgment.'"
question: How does the concept of resurrection relate to the afterlife in Islam?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "Whoever consoles a person with an affliction, then he gets the same reward as him."
question: How does Islam view the act of comforting those who are suffering?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "No Muslim dies on the day of Friday, nor the night of Friday, except that Allah protects him from the trials of the grave."
question: What beliefs do Muslims hold about the spiritual benefits associated with the day of Friday?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said to him: "O Ali! Three are not to be delayed: Salat when it is due, the funeral when it is presented, and (marriage) for the single woman when someone compatible is found."
question: How does Islam view the timing of marriage for a single woman when a compatible partner is found?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever consoles a bereaved mother, he will be clothes with a Burd in Paradise."
question: What is a Burd and what does it symbolize in the context of Paradise?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "The believer's soul is suspended by his debt until it is settled for him."
question: Why is it important for a believer to ensure their debts are paid off?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "The believer's soul is suspended by his debt until it is settled for him."
question: Why is it important for a believer to ensure their debts are paid off?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "The believer is not afflicted by the prick of a thorn or what is worse (or greater) than that, except that by it Allah raises him in rank and removes sin from him."
question: What is the relationship between patience in adversity and the purification of sins in Islam?
